Ocean heat is pushed by the westerly winds and the westerlies have changed around Antarctica in response to climate warming and the depletion of the ozone .
The stronger winds are caused by a world warming faster than a cooling Antarctica .
Stronger westerlies push more subsurface warm waters poleward to melt the glaciers , and push surface waters northward .
